climbs.name: The Goldilocks Zone
climbs.fa: Colin Moorhead, Jamie Selda, Nick McNutt, and Nick Bejcar. September 2021.

content.description:
Beautiful 15-pitch climb on a shady wall.

If you like long moderate multipitch with a bit of approach this wall is for you. There are 2 pitches a bit scruffy but the rest is endless climbing and jamming to the top of a beautiful alpine area.

Link to the description of the developers: The Goldilocks Zone

I will recommend walk back up to the second gully to join the Robin's connector or the Habrich saddle and go down the climber's trail to the gondola and have a fresh pinacolada!!

Rapping the route is a really bad idea, lot's of loose stuff for the teams below and a place you could get your rope stuck, and don't leave anything in the alpine in such a pristine place.



The base of the route is above the top of a prominent fallen tree, cairn at the base of slab and lots of vegetation.


Double set of cams from .3 – #3 + single #4 (I was happy to carry it, placed it 2 times, you could do without it), nuts and lots of alpine draws.

VC Express was put up ground up in day with no bolts. The knowledge of the cliff gained from this FA allowed us to piece together the line that would later become Goldilocks Zone. With a dangerous crux followed by a long and involved traverse there is little to recommend this route. I will enter for the record and to offer future explorers some insight to what has been done on this portion of the wall.   The first 4 pitches are pretty much the same as GL Zone. Following the line of weakness lead us up to left side of the arching overhangs that cap the lower wall. The crux involved high quality but dangerous climbing (feel free to add a bolt here) up a shallow corner followed by a long, tedious traverse under the massive arch feature. From here we climbed essentially what would become the finish Goldilocks Zone. See Goldilocks Zone. Detailed approach and descent info can be found here. Double set of cams, nuts, bolt kit.
Amazing wall lookers right of the Fluffy Kitten Wall, beautiful granite and shady most of the day.
